intro: Clausena willdenowii var. nana, commonly known as dwarf Indian almond tree, is a compact shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some cultures. Its short stature makes it suitable for use in gardens and as a container plant.
